metadata.title: CVE-2024-53432 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
While parsing certain malformed PLY files, PCL version 1.14.1 crashes dueto an uncaught std::out_of_range exception in PCLPointCloud2::at. Thisissue could potentially be exploited to cause a denial-of-service (DoS)attack when processing untrusted PLY files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcl-apps1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-common1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-features1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-filters1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-io1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-kdtree1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-keypoints1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-octree1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-outofcore1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-people1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-recognition1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-registration1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-sample-consensus1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-search1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-segmentation1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-surface1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-tracking1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl-visualization1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
libpcl1.7 - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
pcl-tools - 1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-14ubuntu0.1+esm1').
